message.content:
cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.SY, cs.SE, cs.PL. 

The paper presents a method for statistical verification of quantitative properties over a partially unknown system with actions, utilising a parameterised model (in this work, a parametric Markov decision process) and data collected from experiments performed on the underlying system. This involves exploiting parameter synthesis, actively synthesising experiments, and propagating information over the model parameters to obtain a confidence that reflects our belief whether or not the system parameters lie in the feasible set. This work involves machine learning, optimization, and control theory, which are all relevant to the sub-categories of cs.AI, cs.LG, and cs.SY. Additionally, the paper discusses the use of formal methods for verification, which is relevant to the sub-categories of cs.SE and cs.PL.
